CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1951, pg. 32 reads: "Carnegie Tech Graduates - Five Negroes received degrees at ceremonies at Carnegie Institute of Technology last Thursday. They were, left to right: Vera L. Myers, graduated from Margaret Morrison College. She is a major in home economics and resides in Aliquippa.  Emma Elizabeth Rose, 543 McDonald Street, finished her work in Library School  to earn the degree of Master of Library Science.  Her undergraduate work was done at Pitt...The Courier wishes the [gradu]ates of Carnegie Tech the best of luck in their [vo]cations."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Carnegie Institute of Technology graduates Vera L. Myers, left, and Emma Elizabeth Rose, right, standing near flight of stairs in Syria Mosque, Oakland
